Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding that the Applicant had a viable Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) in Kiev
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; no question certified
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Evidence_Type: Evidence regarding localized issues, state protection in Kiev, personal vendetta not linked to anti-Semitism, resource limitations affecting all citizens
Evaluation_Standard: Risk of persecution in every part of home country
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Localized nature of alleged persecution, personal vendetta, availability of state protection in Kiev, lack of systemic anti-Semitism
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim determination followed by judicial review
Application_Error: Alleged error in finding viable IFA; claimant argued persecution risk extended beyond local context
Review_Outcome: No error found; Board’s conclusion was not patently unreasonable
Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness unless misapplication of law
Legal_Standard: Burden on claimant to prove risk of persecution throughout country
Application_Factor: Personalized threat vs. generalized risk, effectiveness of state protection
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to viable IFA in Kiev
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of IFA finding and application of legal principles
Cause_of_Refusal: Viable Internal Flight Alternative in Kiev
Evidentiary_Issues: Claimant failed to demonstrate that threats were based on protected grounds or would follow to Kiev
Procedural_Fairness: Board adequately considered evidence and applied correct legal framework
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of IFA determination
Procedural_Issue: Appropriateness of judicial review standard applied
